Package com.opengamma.strata.collect

Class TestHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.opengamma.strata.collect.TestHelper
  • public class TestHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Test helper.

    Provides additional classes to help with testing.

      • dateUtc

        public static java.time.ZonedDateTime dateUtc​(int year,
                                              int month,
                                              int dayOfMonth)
        Creates a ZonedDateTime from the date.

        The time is start of day and the zone is UTC.

        Parameters:
        year - the year
        month - the month
        dayOfMonth - the day of month
        Returns:
        the date-time, representing the date at midnight UTC

      • assertEqualsBean

        public static void assertEqualsBean​(org.joda.beans.Bean actual,
                                    org.joda.beans.Bean expected)
        Asserts that two beans are equal. Provides better error messages than a normal assertEquals comparison.
        Parameters:
        actual - the actual bean under test
        expected - the expected bean

      • assertEqualsBeanDetailed

        public static void assertEqualsBeanDetailed​(org.joda.beans.Bean actual,
                                            org.joda.beans.Bean expected)
        Asserts that two beans are equal. Provides better error messages than a normal assertEquals comparison.

        This provides extra detail used when debugging an issue. Normal use should be to call assertEqualsBean(Bean, Bean).

        Parameters:
        actual - the actual bean under test
        expected - the expected bean

      • assertSerialization

        public static void assertSerialization​(java.lang.Object base)
        Asserts that the object can be serialized and deserialized to an equal form.
        Parameters:
        base - the object to be tested

      • assertJodaConvert

        public static <T> void assertJodaConvert​(java.lang.Class<T> cls,
                                         java.lang.Object base)
        Asserts that the object can be serialized and deserialized via a string using Joda-Convert.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type
        Parameters:
        cls - the effective type
        base - the object to be tested

      • assertThrows

        @Deprecated
public static void assertThrows​(AssertRunnable runner,
                                java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.Throwable> expected)
        Deprecated.
        Use AssertJ assertThatExceptionOfType
        Asserts that the lambda-based code throws the specified exception.

        For example: 

          assertThrows(() -> bean.property(""), NoSuchElementException.class);
        Parameters:
        runner - the lambda containing the code to test
        expected - the expected exception

      • assertThrows

        @Deprecated
public static void assertThrows​(AssertRunnable runner,
                                java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.Throwable> expected,
                                java.lang.String regex)
        Deprecated.
        Use AssertJ assertThatExceptionOfType
        Asserts that the lambda-based code throws the specified exception and that the exception message matches the supplied regular expression.

        For example: 

          assertThrows(() -> bean.property(""), NoSuchElementException.class, "Unknown property.*");
        Parameters:
        runner - the lambda containing the code to test
        expected - the expected exception
        regex - the regex that the exception message is expected to match

      • assertThrowsRuntime

        @Deprecated
public static void assertThrowsRuntime​(AssertRunnable runner)
        Deprecated.
        Use AssertJ assertThatExceptionOfType
        Asserts that the lambda-based code throws an RuntimeException.

        For example: 

          assertThrowsRuntime(() -> new Foo(null));
        Parameters:
        runner - the lambda containing the code to test

      • assertThrowsIllegalArg

        @Deprecated
public static void assertThrowsIllegalArg​(AssertRunnable runner)
        Deprecated.
        Use AssertJ assertThatIllegalArgumentException
        Asserts that the lambda-based code throws an IllegalArgumentException.

        For example: 

          assertThrowsIllegalArg(() -> new Foo(null));
        Parameters:
        runner - the lambda containing the code to test

      • assertThrowsIllegalArg

        @Deprecated
public static void assertThrowsIllegalArg​(AssertRunnable runner,
                                          java.lang.String regex)
        Deprecated.
        Use AssertJ assertThatIllegalArgumentException
        Asserts that the lambda-based code throws an IllegalArgumentException and checks the message matches an regex.

        For example: 

          assertThrowsIllegalArg(() -> new Foo(null), "Foo constructor argument must not be null");
        Parameters:
        runner - the lambda containing the code to test
        regex - regular expression that must match the exception message

      • assertThrowsWithCause

        @Deprecated
public static void assertThrowsWithCause​(AssertRunnable runner,
                                         java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.Throwable> cause)
        Deprecated.
        Use AssertJ assertThatExceptionOfType
        Asserts that the lambda-based code throws an exception and that the cause of the exception is the supplied cause.

        For example: 

          assertThrowsWithCause(() ->
    executeSql("INSERT DATA THAT ALREADY EXISTS"), SQLIntegrityConstraintViolationException.class);
        Parameters:
        runner - the lambda containing the code to test
        cause - the expected cause of the exception thrown

      • ignoreThrows

        public static void ignoreThrows​(AssertRunnable runner)
        Ignore any exception thrown by the lambda-based code.

        For example: 

          ignoreThrows(() -> bean.property(""));
        Parameters:
        runner - the lambda containing the code to test

      • caputureSystemOut

        public static java.lang.String caputureSystemOut​(java.lang.Runnable runner)
        Capture system out for testing.

        This returns the output from calls to System.out. This is thread-safe, providing that no other utility alters system out.

        For example: 

          String sysOut = captureSystemOut(() -> myCode);
        Parameters:
        runner - the lambda containing the code to test
        Returns:
        the captured output

      • caputureSystemErr

        public static java.lang.String caputureSystemErr​(java.lang.Runnable runner)
        Capture system err for testing.

        This returns the output from calls to System.err. This is thread-safe, providing that no other utility alters system out.

        For example: 

          String sysErr = captureSystemErr(() -> myCode);
        Parameters:
        runner - the lambda containing the code to test
        Returns:
        the captured output

      • caputureLog

        public static java.util.List<java.util.logging.LogRecord> caputureLog​(java.lang.Class<?> loggerClass,
                                                                      java.lang.Runnable runner)
        Capture log for testing.

        This returns the output from calls to the java logger. This is thread-safe, providing that no other utility alters the logger.

        For example: 

          String log = captureLog(Foo.class, () -> myCode);
        Parameters:
        loggerClass - the class defining the logger to trap
        runner - the lambda containing the code to test
        Returns:
        the captured output

      • assertUtilityClass

        public static void assertUtilityClass​(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Asserts that a class is a well-defined utility class.

        Must be final and with one zero-arg private constructor. All public methods must be static.

        Parameters:
        clazz - the class to test

      • coverPrivateConstructor

        public static void coverPrivateConstructor​(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Test a private no-arg constructor the primary purpose of increasing test coverage.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class to test

      • coverEnum

        public static <E extends java.lang.Enum<E>> void coverEnum​(java.lang.Class<E> clazz)
        Test an enum for the primary purpose of increasing test coverage.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the enum type
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class to test

      • coverMutableBean

        public static void coverMutableBean​(org.joda.beans.Bean bean)
        Test a mutable bean for the primary purpose of increasing test coverage.
        Parameters:
        bean - the bean to test

      • coverImmutableBean

        public static void coverImmutableBean​(org.joda.beans.ImmutableBean bean)
        Test an immutable bean for the primary purpose of increasing test coverage.
        Parameters:
        bean - the bean to test

      • coverBeanEquals

        public static void coverBeanEquals​(org.joda.beans.Bean bean1,
                                   org.joda.beans.Bean bean2)
        Test a bean equals method for the primary purpose of increasing test coverage.

        The two beans passed in should contain a different value for each property. The method creates a cross-product to ensure test coverage of equals.

        Parameters:
        bean1 - the first bean to test
        bean2 - the second bean to test
